title: Audit Trail
description: An audit trail is a security-relevant chronological record providing documentary evidence of the sequence of activities that have affected a specific system.

time.description: Temporal information about when an activity occurred.

when.description: Timestamp when the activity occurred in ISO 8601 format. Example: '2023-11-09T14:30:00Z'.

duration.description: (Optional) Duration of the activity in ISO 8601 duration format (e.g., 'PT2H30M' for 2 hours and 30 minutes).

subject.description: Functional user or system that performed the task.

kind.description: Type of the user or system. 'system' defines an internal action.

id.description: Unique identifier of the actor. If 'kind' is 'system', 'id' should identify which part of the system initiated the activity.

agent.description: (Optional) Software or tool used by the subject to perform the action.

action.description: Describes the action performed by the subject.

kind.description: The type of action: 'dispositive' when changing the functional state or 'informative' when accessing the functional state.

operation.description: Description of the specific action or operation performed (e.g., 'Update Profile', 'Access Report').

result.description: The result of the action: 'succeeded' or 'failed'.

reason.description: (Optional) Human-readable reason for the result. Limited to 25 characters.

changes.description: (Optional) Details of changes made during the action.

param.description: Name of the parameter or attribute that was changed.

oldValue.description: (Optional) The previous value of the parameter.

newValue.description: (Optional) The new value of the parameter.

target.description: Describes the target or resource affected by the action.
